channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
See photo, please straighten.

item.title: Scaffolding fences, 1st September
item.description:
Each block on Whiston estate has fencing and materials from when scaffolding was erected 6 months ago Children have been playing in the areas and have been hurt The materials need be took away
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Closing early for years, not following the timetable, 1st September
item.description:
This complaint system doesn't work. Those reports have been here for years and I personally have been messaging council and parks team. That's such a shame... Unfortunately, the same person has continued closing the park early this year too — and it’s only the 1st of September. They’ve been very rude, rushing everyone out — including pregnant women, children, and people with limited mobility. When I told them that they're not following the timetable published in the park, they told me "says who?". Tells a lot about how everyone here cares about community :) Same thing happens to Edbrooke Road Gardens.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warlock Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole street has rubbish piled up outside binsheds, 1st September
item.description:
Rubbish piled up is preventing residents from using bins correctly, can you check outside each block as last time the collection team came half of it got left behind
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Parks are closing early for years, nothing changes, 1st September
item.description:
This complaint system doesn't work. Those reports have been here for years and I personally have been messaging council and parks team. That's such a shame... Unfortunately, the same person has continued closing the park early this year too — and it’s only the 1st of September. They’ve been very rude, rushing everyone out — including pregnant women, children, and people with limited mobility. Same thing happens to Tamplin Mews Gardens.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Edbrooke Road, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous extremely deep potholes, 1st September
item.description:
These numerous, very deep pot holes have been in Norman Park car park for a very long time without repair. They are extremely deep and a danger to both cars and people/children. I have never seen such large, deep potholes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Farm Road, Southborough, London

item.description:

item.title: Dumped Household Items, 1st September
item.description:
This rubbish has been there for 2 days. It's infuriating that careless and irresponsible people continue on a regular basis to leave their household rubbish at this location, instead of booking a slot at the Churchfields Waste Disposal site or requesting a collection via the Bromley Council website.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 127a, Venner Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
